Question 56) World demand for food production progressively increases at very high rates. Currently, in most countries, continents and regions, the water consumed in agriculture is about 70% of total availability.
TUNDISI, J. G. Water resources in the future: problems and solutions.
In order to reduce pressure on the mentioned natural resource, the expansion of agriculture requires improvements in (A)
A) Soil chemical fertilization.
B) Water flow of the terrain.
C) Maintenance of artesian wells.
D) efficiency of irrigation techniques.
E) velocity of harvesting machines.
